metadata.Title: CVE-2021-1870 on Ubuntu 20.04 FIPS Certified (focal) - medium.
metadata.Description:
A logic issue was addressed with improved restrictions. This issue is fixed in macOS Big Sur 11.2, Security Update 2021-001 Catalina, Security Update 2021-001 Mojave, iOS 14.4 and iPadOS 14.4. A remote attacker may be able to cause arbitrary code execution. Apple is aware of a report that this issue may have been actively exploited..

Update Instructions:

Run `sudo pro fix CVE-2021-1870` to fix the vulnerability. The problem can be corrected
by updating your system to the following package versions:

gir1.2-javascriptcoregtk-4.0 - 2.30.6-0ubuntu0.20.04.1
gir1.2-webkit2-4.0 - 2.30.6-0ubuntu0.20.04.1
libjavascriptcoregtk-4.0-18 - 2.30.6-0ubuntu0.20.04.1
libjavascriptcoregtk-4.0-bin - 2.30.6-0ubuntu0.20.04.1
libwebkit2gtk-4.0-37 - 2.30.6-0ubuntu0.20.04.1
libwebkit2gtk-4.0-37-gtk2 - 2.30.6-0ubuntu0.20.04.1
webkit2gtk-driver - 2.30.6-0ubuntu0.20.04.1
No subscription required

notes.Note: jdstrand> webkit receives limited support. For details, see https://wiki.ubuntu.com/SecurityTeam/FAQ#webkit webkit in Ubuntu uses the JavaScriptCore (JSC) engine, not V8

criterions.comment: qtwebkit-opensource-src package in focal is affected and may need fixing.
webkit2gtk package in focal was vulnerable but has been fixed (note: '2.30.6-0ubuntu0.20.04.1').
wpewebkit package in focal is affected and may need fixing.
